burlap.debugtools

Class DPrint

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.debugtools.DPrint

  • public class DPrint
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for managing debug print statements. Different debug print statements can be associated with different debug ids and enabling or disabling print commands for that debug id can be performed from any class
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DPrint()

      A printf command for the given debug code.
      static void cl(int c, java.lang.String s)
      A print line command for the given debug code.
      static boolean mode(int c)
      Returns the print mode for a given debug code
      static void toggleCode(int c, boolean mode)
      Enables/disables print commands to the given debug code

      Specify whether previously unset debug codes will by default be allowed to print or not.

    • Method Detail

      • toggleUniversal

        public static void toggleUniversal(boolean mode)
        Specify whether previously unset debug codes will by default be allowed to print or not.
        Parameters:
        mode - whether to enable default printing or default suppression.

      • toggleCode

        public static void toggleCode(int c,
              boolean mode)
        Enables/disables print commands to the given debug code
        Parameters:
        c - the print debug code to set
        mode - true indicates that print calls to that code will print; false means that they will not

      • ul

        public static void ul(java.lang.String s)
        A universal print line whose behavior is determined by the universalPrint field
        Parameters:
        s - the string to print

      • u

        public static void u(java.lang.String s)
        A universal print whose behavior is determined by the universalPrint field
        Parameters:
        s - the string to print

      • uf

        public static void uf(java.lang.String s,
      java.lang.Object... args)
        A universal printf whose behavior is determined by the universalPrint field
        Parameters:
        s - the format string
        args - the arguments for the formatted string

      • cl

        public static void cl(int c,
      java.lang.String s)
        A print line command for the given debug code. If that debug code is set to false, then the print will not occur.
        Parameters:
        c - the debug code under which printing should be performed
        s - the string to print

      • c

        public static void c(int c,
     java.lang.String s)
        A print command for the given debug code. If that debug code is set to false, then the print will not occur.
        Parameters:
        c - the debug code under which printing should be performed
        s - the string to print

      • cf

        public static void cf(int c,
      java.lang.String s,
      java.lang.Object... args)
        A printf command for the given debug code. If that debug code is set to false, then the print will not occur.
        Parameters:
        c - the debug code under which printing should be performed
        s - the format string
        args - the arguments for the formatted string

      • mode

        public static boolean mode(int c)
        Returns the print mode for a given debug code
        Parameters:
        c - the code to query.
        Returns:
        true if printing to that debug code is allowed; false if it is not allowed.
